tournament.name: Duel Commander Semanal - Academia de jogos (SÃ£o Paulo, Brazil)

decks.notes: The deck focuses on being aggressive and dealing damage quickly with Vial Smasher the Fierce as the commander. It includes a mix of creatures and spells that can disrupt the opponent's game plan while also dealing direct damage. The deck aims to control the board state with removal spells like Damnation and Collective Brutality, as well as countermagic like Counterspell and Force of Will. It also includes card advantage spells like Brainstorm and Fact or Fiction to help maintain resources. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to apply pressure, disrupt the opponent, and control the game in order to win through aggressive plays and efficient use of resources.

This deck revolves around utilizing the aggressive power of Vial Smasher the Fierce to deal damage to opponents. The deck includes a variety of efficient creatures and removal spells to apply pressure and control the board. With cards like Lightning Bolt, Terminate, and Abrupt Decay, the deck can clear threats while dealing direct damage to opponents. The deck also includes powerful cards like Demonic Tutor and Survival of the Fittest to search for key creatures and answers. By combining a fast and aggressive playstyle with strong removal and card advantage, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victories through a combination of creature beatdown and direct damage.

This deck focuses on maximizing aggression through a combination of efficient creatures, removal spells, and combat tricks. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and consistent beatdown strategy, utilizing Saskia the Unyielding's ability to deal additional damage to opponents and ensure that no player is safe from the assault. The deck includes a mix of powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf, Loxodon Smiter, and Fleecemane Lion, as well as versatile removal options such as Swords to Plowshares and Terminate. With a solid mana base to support its aggressive game plan and a selection of disruptive spells to handle opposing threats, this deck is designed to apply constant pressure and secure victories quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble a wide board of creatures quickly, leveraging mana dorks like Elvish Mystic and Birds of Paradise to ramp into powerful threats like Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite and Craterhoof Behemoth. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful utility cards like Sylvan Library and Survival of the Fittest. Additionally, the deck includes combo pieces like Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana and win the game on the spot. The inclusion of various tutors like Birthing Pod and Green Sun's Zenith allows the deck to search for key pieces and assemble its game plan efficiently.

The main focus of this deck revolves around utilizing Geist of Saint Traft as the commander to control the game. The deck includes a wide array of counterspells, removal spells, and tempo cards to disrupt the opponent's game plan while protecting Geist and setting up win conditions. Additionally, the deck includes equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and swords to enhance Geist's effectiveness in combat. The deck is designed to maintain control of the board while chipping away at the opponent's life total with Geist and other evasive threats. Overall, the strategy involves outmaneuvering the opponent through efficient spellcasting and strategic use of Geist's abilities to secure victory in a 1 vs 1 duel.

The deck focuses on utilizing Leovold, Emissary of Trest as the commander to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The main strategy involves card advantage and resource denial through cards like Teferi's Puzzle Box and various counterspells. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells and creature threats to maintain board presence and handle different types of threats. The mana base is designed to support the three-color requirements of the deck while also providing access to a variety of colors for spells. Overall, the deck aims to control the game tempo, disrupt the opponent's plans, and ultimately outvalue them to secure a victory.

The deck revolves around using Ob Nixilis, the Fallen as the commander to quickly overwhelm opponents with aggressive plays and disruption. The main focus is on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's hand while also ramping up mana with cards like Jet Medallion and Cabal Coffers. With a strong suite of removal spells like Damnation, Toxic Deluge, and Mutilate, the deck can quickly clear the board and establish dominance. Additionally, the deck includes a variety of tutor effects like Demonic Tutor and Beseech the Queen to find key pieces like Phyrexian Obliterator and Necropotence. Overall, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent and control the game with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful spells.

The main focus of this deck is to be aggressive and deal damage quickly to the opponent. With Zurgo Bellstriker as the commander, the deck includes a variety of low-cost creatures and burn spells to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Cards like Lightning Bolt, Goblin Rabblemaster, and Eidolon of the Great Revel help keep the pressure on while preventing the opponent from gaining control of the board. The deck also includes disruption elements like Sulfuric Vortex and Price of Progress to punish opponents who rely heavily on non-basic lands. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast creatures and direct damage spells to secure a quick victory.
